chat.projectsIntro: He has participated in several important projects, including DamFormer dam-break flow prediction, Rs-ModCubes modular robots, bionic undulating fin propulsion system, and fan array wind tunnel experimental platform.
chat.educationIntro: Zhaoyang Mu is a Master's student in AI at Dalian Maritime University and a visiting student at Westlake University.
chat.contactIntro: You can contact Zhaoyang Mu via email, phone, or visit his social platforms such as GitHub and LinkedIn.
chat.skillsIntro: He masters Python, MATLAB, C++, Java, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Star-CCM+, ANSYS Fluent, OpenFOAM, STM32, Arduino, etc.
chat.defaultHelp: I'm Zhaoyang Mu's AI assistant. Ask about his research areas, projects, skills, or education to get started.

hero.name: Zhaoyang Mu
hero.title: AI Master Student at Dalian Maritime University & Visiting Student at Westlake University
hero.description: Focused on the intersection of scientific computing and robotics, dedicated to Transformer/Neural Operator modeling of CFD spatiotemporal fields, advancing technological innovation and practical applications. Currently in Hangzhou conducting bionic undulating fin propulsion simulation research.

research.title: Research

scientificComputing.title: Scientific Computing
scientificComputing.description: Research in computational fluid dynamics, neural operators, and high-performance computing

publication1.title: DamFormer: A Transformer-based Model for Dam-break Flow Prediction with Cross-geometry Generalization
publication1.abstract: This paper proposes the DamFormer model based on Transformer architecture for cross-geometry dam-break flow prediction. The model achieves high-precision flow field prediction under different geometric configurations, providing new technical means for dam-break disaster assessment. A multi-geometry boundary dataset is constructed to achieve cross-geometry zero-shot prediction, solving the problem of high computational cost in traditional CFD simulations.

publication2.title: Sparse→Dense Transformer: Sparse-to-Dense Field Reconstruction
publication2.abstract: For CFD/environmental flow, sparse sensing reconstruction of high-resolution spatiotemporal fields. Based on Transformer architecture to achieve intelligent reconstruction from sparse observations to dense fields, providing an efficient flow field reconstruction method.

publication3.title: CFD-FSI Analysis of Bionic Undulating Fin Propulsion System
publication3.authors: Zhaoyang Mu, Westlake University Research Team
publication3.journal: International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA)
publication3.abstract: Westlake University i⁴-FSI Laboratory project. CFD/FSI coupled simulation analysis of bionic undulating fin propulsion system through Star-CCM+, Java Macro automated parameter sweeping, exploring bionic propulsion mechanisms.

patent1.title: A Modular Self-reconfigurable Robot System
patent1.abstract: This invention discloses a modular self-reconfigurable cubic robot system Rs-ModCubes with autonomous reconfiguration capability and multiple motion modes, suitable for robot applications in complex environments.

patent2.title: Underwater Robot Bionic Sensing Device and Sensing Method
patent2.abstract: This invention provides an underwater robot bionic sensing device that achieves sensitive detection of water flow changes based on TENG technology, combined with artificial lateral line structure to improve sensing accuracy.

patent3.title: Fan Array Wind Tunnel Experimental Platform Control System
patent3.abstract: Modular 2.5m×2.5m fan array, STM32 multi-board PWM/TACH closed-loop control, VLAN/DHCP network management. Experimental platform for flow field control and test verification.

publication1.title: DamFormer: A Transformer-based Model for Dam-break Flow Prediction with Cross-geometry Generalization
publication1.abstract: This paper proposes the DamFormer model based on Transformer architecture for cross-geometry dam-break flow prediction. The model achieves high-precision flow field prediction under different geometric configurations, providing new technical means for dam-break disaster assessment. A multi-geometry boundary dataset is constructed to achieve cross-geometry zero-shot prediction, solving the problem of high computational cost in traditional CFD simulations.

publication2.title: Sparse→Dense Transformer: Sparse-to-Dense Field Reconstruction
publication2.abstract: For CFD/environmental flow, sparse sensing reconstruction of high-resolution spatiotemporal fields. Based on Transformer architecture to achieve intelligent reconstruction from sparse observations to dense fields, providing an efficient flow field reconstruction method.

publication3.authors: Zhaoyang Mu, Westlake University Research Team

patent1.abstract: This invention discloses a modular self-reconfigurable cubic robot system Rs-ModCubes with autonomous reconfiguration capability and multiple motion modes, suitable for robot applications in complex environments.

underwaterNavigation.title: Underwater Navigation Device and Method Based on Bionic Perception
underwaterNavigation.description: This invention discloses an underwater navigation device and method based on bionic perception, achieving precise underwater environmental perception and navigation by simulating fish lateral line systems.

vectorThruster.title: Vector Thruster and Its Control Method
vectorThruster.description: This invention relates to a vector thruster and its control method, capable of achieving omnidirectional thrust control and improving the maneuverability of underwater robots.

undulatingFin.title: Bionic Undulating Fin Propulsion Device
undulatingFin.description: This invention discloses a bionic undulating fin propulsion device that simulates fish swimming patterns to achieve efficient underwater propulsion.

flexibleFin.title: Flexible Fin Underwater Robot with Embedded Multi-sensors and Its Operation Method
flexibleFin.description: This invention relates to a flexible fin underwater robot with embedded multi-sensors and its operation method, achieving bionic swimming propulsion through flexible materials and intelligent actuation.

smartShip.title: Ship with Intelligent Dynamic Sensing System
smartShip.description: This invention discloses a ship with intelligent dynamic sensing system that integrates multiple sensors and intelligent algorithms to achieve autonomous navigation and obstacle avoidance for ships.

mobileBuoy.title: Mobile Buoy Robot
mobileBuoy.description: This design relates to a mobile buoy robot with good stability and maneuverability, suitable for marine environment monitoring.

underwaterRobot.title: Underwater Robot
underwaterRobot.description: This design relates to an underwater robot with streamlined shape and optimized propulsion system design.

underwaterDetection.title: Underwater Detection Robot
underwaterDetection.description: This design discloses an underwater detection robot specifically designed for underwater environment detection and monitoring tasks.

internetPlusGold.title: Gold Award in the 8th China International \"Internet+\" College Students Innovation and Entrepreneurship Competition
internetPlusGold.description: Won the gold award in the 8th China International \"Internet+\" College Students Innovation and Entrepreneurship Competition with the \"Kunpeng Technology - Leader in Underwater Hull Inspection Robots\" project, demonstrating innovation capabilities in underwater robotics technology.

damformer.title: Generalizing morphologies in dam break simulations using transformer model
damformer.description: Proposed a Transformer-based neural operator DamFormer for predicting dam-break flows. This method can handle fluid dynamics problems under different geometric boundary conditions and achieve cross-geometric generalization capabilities.

rsModCubes.title: Design of Reconfigurable Robot System Based on Improved Modular Cubes
rsModCubes.description: Designed a reconfigurable robot system based on improved modular cubes with good reconfigurability and adaptability, capable of autonomously reconfiguring morphology according to task requirements.

whiskerSensorArray.title: Underwater Robot Environmental Perception System Based on Bionic Whisker Sensor Array
whiskerSensorArray.description: Developed an underwater robot environmental perception system based on bionic whisker sensor array, simulating the perception mechanism of fish lateral line system to improve underwater environmental perception capabilities.

whiskerSensor.title: Design and Optimization of High-Sensitivity Bionic Whisker Sensor
whiskerSensor.description: Designed a high-sensitivity bionic whisker sensor capable of detecting minute fluid disturbances, providing precise environmental perception capabilities for underwater robots.

sparseToDense.title: Transformer-based Sparse-to-Dense Flow Field Reconstruction Method
sparseToDense.description: Proposed a Transformer-based method for reconstructing dense flow fields from sparse sensor data, capable of reconstructing complete flow field information from limited sensor data.

publication1.title: DamFormer: A Transformer-based Model for Dam-break Flow Prediction with Cross-geometry Generalization
publication1.abstract: This paper proposes the DamFormer model based on Transformer architecture for cross-geometric boundary prediction of dam-break flow fields. The model can achieve high-precision flow field prediction under different geometric configurations, providing new technical means for dam-break disaster assessment. Construct multi-geometric boundary datasets, achieve cross-geometric zero-shot prediction, and solve the problem of high computational cost of traditional CFD simulation.

publication2.title: Sparse→Dense Transformer: Sparse to Dense Field Reconstruction
publication2.abstract: For CFD/environmental flow, sparse sensing reconstructs high-resolution spatio-temporal fields. Based on Transformer architecture to achieve intelligent reconstruction from sparse observations to dense fields, providing an efficient flow field reconstruction method.

publication3.title: CFD-FSI Analysis of Bionic Undulating Fin Propulsion System
publication3.authors: Zhaoyang Mu, Westlake University Research Team
publication3.journal: International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA)
publication3.abstract: Westlake University i⁴-FSI Laboratory project. Through Star-CCM+ CFD/FSI coupled simulation analysis of bionic undulating fin propulsion system, Java Macro automated parameter scanning, exploring bionic propulsion mechanisms.

patent1.title: A Self-reconfigurable Robot System Based on Modular Design
patent1.abstract: This invention discloses a self-reconfigurable cubic robot system Rs-ModCubes based on modular design, with autonomous reconfiguration capability and multiple motion modes, suitable for robot applications in complex environments.

patent2.title: Underwater Robot Bionic Perception Device and Its Perception Method
patent2.abstract: This invention provides an underwater robot bionic perception device, based on TENG technology to achieve sensitive detection of water flow changes, combined with artificial lateral line structure to improve perception accuracy.

patent3.title: Fan Array Wind Tunnel Experimental Platform Control System
patent3.abstract: Modular 2.5m×2.5m fan array, STM32 multi-board PWM/TACH closed-loop control, VLAN/DHCP network management. Experimental platform for flow field control and test verification.

damformer.title: DamFormer: A Transformer-based Neural Operator for Dam-break Flow Prediction
damformer.description: Proposed a Transformer-based neural operator DamFormer for predicting dam-break flows. This method can handle fluid dynamics problems under different geometric boundary conditions and achieve cross-geometric generalization capabilities.

rsModCubes.title: Design of Reconfigurable Robot System Based on Improved Modular Cubes
rsModCubes.description: Designed a reconfigurable robot system based on improved modular cubes with good reconfigurability and adaptability, capable of autonomously reconfiguring morphology according to task requirements.

whiskerSensorArray.title: Underwater Robot Environmental Perception System Based on Bionic Whisker Sensor Array
whiskerSensorArray.description: Developed an underwater robot environmental perception system based on bionic whisker sensor array, simulating the perception mechanism of fish lateral line system to improve underwater environmental perception capabilities.

whiskerSensor.title: Design and Optimization of High-Sensitivity Bionic Whisker Sensor
whiskerSensor.description: Designed a high-sensitivity bionic whisker sensor capable of detecting minute fluid disturbances, providing precise environmental perception capabilities for underwater robots.

sparseToDense.title: Transformer-based Sparse-to-Dense Flow Field Reconstruction
sparseToDense.description: Proposed a Transformer-based method for reconstructing dense flow fields from sparse sensor data, capable of reconstructing complete flow field information from limited sensor data.

underwaterNavigation.title: Underwater Navigation Device and Method Based on Bionic Perception
underwaterNavigation.description: This invention discloses an underwater navigation device and method based on bionic perception, achieving precise underwater environmental perception and navigation by simulating fish lateral line systems.

vectorThruster.title: Vector Thruster and Its Control Method
vectorThruster.description: This invention relates to a vector thruster and its control method, capable of achieving omnidirectional thrust control and improving the maneuverability of underwater robots.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: Showcasing my project achievements in scientific computing, robotics, and software development
projects.noResultsDesc: Please try adjusting your search criteria or filters

damformer.title: DamFormer: Transformer-based Dam-break Flow Prediction
damformer.description: Innovatively applying Transformer architecture to computational fluid dynamics, achieving cross-geometric generalization prediction of dam-break flows. This project significantly improves computational efficiency while maintaining high accuracy, providing new solutions for fluid dynamics numerical simulation.

highlights.crossGeometric: First application of Transformer architecture to dam-break flow prediction
highlights.published: Achieved cross-geometric boundary generalization prediction capability
highlights.architecture: Improved computational efficiency by over 100x compared to traditional methods
highlights.dataset: Achieved state-of-the-art performance on multiple benchmark tests

sparseToDense.title: Sparse-to-Dense Flow Field Reconstruction
sparseToDense.description: Transformer-based neural operator for high-precision reconstruction from sparse sensor data to dense flow fields, providing new technical pathways for fluid monitoring and prediction.

highlights.sparseReconstruction: Achieved dense flow field reconstruction from sparse sensor data
highlights.highAccuracy: Achieved high accuracy in various flow field reconstruction tasks
highlights.realTimeProcessing: Supports real-time flow field reconstruction and prediction

bionicRobot.title: Bionic Perception Underwater Robot System
bionicRobot.description: Based on fish lateral line system principles, designed and implemented intelligent underwater robots with environmental perception capabilities. The system can detect water flow changes and obstacle positions in real-time, providing new technical solutions for underwater operations.

highlights.bionicPerception: Simulated fish lateral line system bionic perception mechanism
highlights.realTimeDetection: Achieved real-time water flow change detection
highlights.complexEnvironment: Validated effectiveness in complex water environments

fanWall.title: Fan Array Experimental Platform
fanWall.description: Designed and built a modular fan array experimental platform for flow control and turbulence research. The platform features high configurability and precise control capabilities, providing powerful tools for fluid mechanics experiments.

highlights.pwmTach: PWM speed control and tachometer feedback

marineBuoy.title: Marine Observation Buoy
marineBuoy.description: Designed the mechanical structure of a marine observation buoy with excellent sealing and corrosion resistance, capable of stable long-term operation in harsh marine environments, providing reliable observation platforms for marine scientific research.

highlights.structureSealing: Optimized structural sealing and anti-corrosion design
highlights.buoyancyCalculation: Precise buoyancy calculation and stability analysis

serverHpc.title: High Performance Computing Server Cluster
serverHpc.description: Built and maintained high-performance computing server clusters supporting large-scale deep learning training and scientific computing tasks. The cluster features efficient resource scheduling and task management capabilities, providing powerful computational support for research work.

bionicFin.title: Bionic Undulating Fin Propulsion Simulation
bionicFin.description: CFD-FSI coupled simulation research of bionic propulsion systems based on fish swimming mechanisms. Conducted at Westlake University i⁴-FSI Laboratory, exploring the propulsion mechanisms and optimization design of bionic undulating fins to provide theoretical foundations for underwater robot propulsion systems.

highlights.bionicMechanism: Bionic design based on fish swimming mechanisms
highlights.westlakeCollaboration: Collaboration project with Westlake University i⁴-FSI Laboratory

research.introduction: I am Zhaoyang Mu, currently focused on interdisciplinary research in computational fluid dynamics, robotics, and artificial intelligence. My research interests include neural operators, deep learning applications in scientific computing, and bionic robot system design.

Integration of artificial intelligence and traditional engineering
